title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 609.3 - Nonreimbursable costs
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 609.3 - Nonreimbursable costs

State Regulations

Except when permitted by specific direction of the
department, reimbursement may not be claimed for services, supplies, assistance, care or other items which must be provided without charge. Reimbursement may be claimed for items for which an entity could have charged, but did not, when the entity entitled to make such charge is required to be
reimbursed by a social services district under circumstances which permit the
cost to be reimbursed by the Federal or State government. All other items for
which an entity could have charged, but did not, are not
reimbursable. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
ยง
609.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
